trans-unit.source: Display points of interest (POI) on a map
trans-unit.target: Display points of interest (POI) on a map

trans-unit.source: Add points of interest (POI) to a map using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Add points of interest (POI) to a map using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.

trans-unit.source: Display points of interest (POI) on a map
trans-unit.target: Display points of interest (POI) on a map

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Add points of interest (POI) to a map using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Add points of interest (POI) to a map using pushpins, images, shapes, and XAML UI elements.

trans-unit.source: A POI is a specific point on the map that represents something of interest.
trans-unit.target: A POI is a specific point on the map that represents something of interest.

trans-unit.source: For example, the location of a business, city, or friend.
trans-unit.target: For example, the location of a business, city, or friend.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** To learn more about displaying POI on your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** To learn more about displaying POI on your app, download the following sample from the [Windows-universal-samples repo](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619979) on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

trans-unit.source: Display pushpins, images, and shapes on the map by adding [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077), [**MapPolygon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637103), and [**MapPolyline**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637114) objects to the [**MapElements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637033) collection of the map control.
trans-unit.target: Display pushpins, images, and shapes on the map by adding [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077), [**MapPolygon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637103), and [**MapPolyline**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637114) objects to the [**MapElements**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637033) collection of the map control.

trans-unit.source: Use data binding or add items programmatically; you can't bind to the **MapElements** collection declaratively in your XAML markup.
trans-unit.target: Use data binding or add items programmatically; you can't bind to the **MapElements** collection declaratively in your XAML markup.

trans-unit.source: Display XAML user interface elements such as a [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209265), a [**HyperlinkButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242739), or a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) on the map by adding them as [**Children**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637008) of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: Display XAML user interface elements such as a [**Button**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209265), a [**HyperlinkButton**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242739), or a [**TextBlock**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209652) on the map by adding them as [**Children**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637008) of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).

trans-unit.source: You can also add them to the [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094), or bind the **MapItemsControl** to a collection of items.
trans-unit.target: You can also add them to the [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094), or bind the **MapItemsControl** to a collection of items.

trans-unit.source: In summary:
trans-unit.target: In summary:

trans-unit.source: [Add a MapIcon to the map](#mapicon) to display an image such as a pushpin with optional text.
trans-unit.target: [Add a MapIcon to the map](#mapicon) to display an image such as a pushpin with optional text.

trans-unit.source: [Add a MapPolygon to the map](#mappolygon) to display a multi-point shape.
trans-unit.target: [Add a MapPolygon to the map](#mappolygon) to display a multi-point shape.

trans-unit.source: [Add a MapPolyline to the map](#mappolyline) to display lines on the map.
trans-unit.target: [Add a MapPolyline to the map](#mappolyline) to display lines on the map.

trans-unit.source: [Add XAML to the map](#mapxaml) to display custom UI elements.
trans-unit.target: [Add XAML to the map](#mapxaml) to display custom UI elements.

trans-unit.source: If you have a large number of elements to place on the map, consider [overlaying tiled images on the map](overlay-tiled-images.md).
trans-unit.target: If you have a large number of elements to place on the map, consider [overlaying tiled images on the map](overlay-tiled-images.md).

trans-unit.source: To display roads on the map, see [Display routes and directions](routes-and-directions.md).
trans-unit.target: To display roads on the map, see [Display routes and directions](routes-and-directions.md).

trans-unit.source: Add a MapIcon
trans-unit.target: Add a MapIcon

trans-unit.source: Display an image such a pushpin, with optional text, on the map by using the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) class.
trans-unit.target: Display an image such a pushpin, with optional text, on the map by using the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) class.

trans-unit.source: You can accept the default image or provide a custom image by using the [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property.
trans-unit.target: You can accept the default image or provide a custom image by using the [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property.

trans-unit.source: The following image displays the default image for a **MapIcon** with no value specified for the [**Title**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637088) property, with a short title, with a long title, and with a very long title.
trans-unit.target: The following image displays the default image for a **MapIcon** with no value specified for the [**Title**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637088) property, with a short title, with a long title, and with a very long title.

trans-unit.source: sample mapicon with titles of different lengths.
trans-unit.target: sample mapicon with titles of different lengths.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a map of the city of Seattle and adds a [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) with the default image and an optional title to indicate the location of the Space Needle.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a map of the city of Seattle and adds a [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) with the default image and an optional title to indicate the location of the Space Needle.

trans-unit.source: It also centers the map over the icon and zooms in.
trans-unit.target: It also centers the map over the icon and zooms in.

trans-unit.source: For general info about using the map control, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](display-maps.md).
trans-unit.target: For general info about using the map control, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](display-maps.md).

trans-unit.source: This example displays the following POI on the map (the default image in the center).
trans-unit.target: This example displays the following POI on the map (the default image in the center).

trans-unit.source: map with mapicon
trans-unit.target: map with mapicon

trans-unit.source: The following line of code displays the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) with a custom image saved in the Assets folder of the project.
trans-unit.target: The following line of code displays the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) with a custom image saved in the Assets folder of the project.

trans-unit.source: The [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property of the **MapIcon** expects a value of type [**RandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701813).
trans-unit.target: The [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property of the **MapIcon** expects a value of type [**RandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701813).

trans-unit.source: This type requires a **using** statement for the [**Windows.Storage.Streams**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241791) namespace.
trans-unit.target: This type requires a **using** statement for the [**Windows.Storage.Streams**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241791) namespace.

trans-unit.source: **Tip** If you use the same image for multiple map icons, declare the [**RandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701813) at the page or app level for the best performance.
trans-unit.target: **Tip** If you use the same image for multiple map icons, declare the [**RandomAccessStreamReference**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701813) at the page or app level for the best performance.

trans-unit.source: Keep these considerations in mind when working with the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) class:
trans-unit.target: Keep these considerations in mind when working with the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) class:

trans-unit.source: The [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property supports a maximum image size of 2048×2048 pixels.
trans-unit.target: The [**Image**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637078) property supports a maximum image size of 2048×2048 pixels.

trans-unit.source: By default, the map icon's image is not guaranteed to be shown.
trans-unit.target: By default, the map icon's image is not guaranteed to be shown.

trans-unit.source: It may be hidden when it obscures other elements or labels on the map.
trans-unit.target: It may be hidden when it obscures other elements or labels on the map.

trans-unit.source: To keep it visible, set the map icon's [**CollisionBehaviorDesired**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974327) property to [**MapElementCollisionBehavior.RemainVisible**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974314).
trans-unit.target: To keep it visible, set the map icon's [**CollisionBehaviorDesired**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974327) property to [**MapElementCollisionBehavior.RemainVisible**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974314).

trans-unit.source: The optional [**Title**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637088) of the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) is not guaranteed to be shown.
trans-unit.target: The optional [**Title**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637088) of the [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) is not guaranteed to be shown.

trans-unit.source: If you don't see the text, zoom out by decreasing the value of the [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637068) property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: If you don't see the text, zoom out by decreasing the value of the [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637068) property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).

trans-unit.source: When you display a [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) image that points to a specific location on the map - for example, a pushpin or an arrow - consider setting the value of the [**NormalizedAnchorPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637082) property to the approximate location of the pointer on the image.
trans-unit.target: When you display a [**MapIcon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637077) image that points to a specific location on the map - for example, a pushpin or an arrow - consider setting the value of the [**NormalizedAnchorPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637082) property to the approximate location of the pointer on the image.

trans-unit.source: If you leave the value of **NormalizedAnchorPoint** at its default value of (0, 0), which represents the upper left corner of the image, changes in the [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637068) of the map may leave the image pointing to a different location.
trans-unit.target: If you leave the value of **NormalizedAnchorPoint** at its default value of (0, 0), which represents the upper left corner of the image, changes in the [**ZoomLevel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637068) of the map may leave the image pointing to a different location.

trans-unit.source: Add a MapPolygon
trans-unit.target: Add a MapPolygon

trans-unit.source: Display a multi-point shape on the map by using the [**MapPolygon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637103) class.
trans-unit.target: Display a multi-point shape on the map by using the [**MapPolygon**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637103) class.

trans-unit.source: The following example, from the [UWP map sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619977), displays a red box with blue border on the map.
trans-unit.target: The following example, from the [UWP map sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619977), displays a red box with blue border on the map.

trans-unit.source: Add a MapPolyline
trans-unit.target: Add a MapPolyline

trans-unit.source: Display a line on the map by using the [**MapPolyline**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637114) class.
trans-unit.target: Display a line on the map by using the [**MapPolyline**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637114) class.

trans-unit.source: The following example, from the [UWP map sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619977), displays a dashed line on the map.
trans-unit.target: The following example, from the [UWP map sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=619977), displays a dashed line on the map.

trans-unit.source: Add XAML
trans-unit.target: Add XAML

trans-unit.source: Display custom UI elements on the map using XAML.
trans-unit.target: Display custom UI elements on the map using XAML.

trans-unit.source: Position XAML on the map by specifying the location and normalized anchor point of the XAML.
trans-unit.target: Position XAML on the map by specifying the location and normalized anchor point of the XAML.

trans-unit.source: Set the location on the map where the XAML is placed by calling [**SetLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms704369).
trans-unit.target: Set the location on the map where the XAML is placed by calling [**SetLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms704369).

trans-unit.source: Set the relative location on the XAML that corresponds to the specified location by calling [**SetNormalizedAnchorPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637050).
trans-unit.target: Set the relative location on the XAML that corresponds to the specified location by calling [**SetNormalizedAnchorPoint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637050).

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a map of the city of Seattle and adds a XAML [**Border**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209250) control to indicate the location of the Space Needle.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a map of the city of Seattle and adds a XAML [**Border**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209250) control to indicate the location of the Space Needle.

trans-unit.source: It also centers the map over the area and zooms in.
trans-unit.target: It also centers the map over the area and zooms in.

trans-unit.source: For general info about using the map control, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](display-maps.md).
trans-unit.target: For general info about using the map control, see [Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views](display-maps.md).

trans-unit.source: This example displays a blue border on the map.
trans-unit.target: This example displays a blue border on the map.

trans-unit.source: The next examples show how to add XAML UI elements directly in the XAML markup of the page using data binding.
trans-unit.target: The next examples show how to add XAML UI elements directly in the XAML markup of the page using data binding.

trans-unit.source: As with other XAML elements that display content, [**Children**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637008) is the default content property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004) and does not have to be specified explicitly in XAML markup.
trans-unit.target: As with other XAML elements that display content, [**Children**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637008) is the default content property of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004) and does not have to be specified explicitly in XAML markup.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to display two XAML controls as implicit children of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to display two XAML controls as implicit children of the [**MapControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637004).

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to display two XAML controls contained within a [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094).
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to display two XAML controls contained within a [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094).

trans-unit.source: This example displays a collection of XAML elements bound to a [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094).
trans-unit.target: This example displays a collection of XAML elements bound to a [**MapItemsControl**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn637094).
